subject: Critical Thinking
title: Cherry-Picking: The Art of Selective Evidence
description: A quick, practical guide to Cherry-Picking: The Art of Selective Evidence.

hook.text: 'Since 1998, global warming has slowed.' True ‚Äî if you start from 1998, an unusually hot El Ni√±o year. Otherwise, false.

buildup.text: Cherry-picking: selecting data that supports your claim while ignoring data that contradicts it.

discovery.text: It's different from lying ‚Äî the individual facts may be true. The deception is in what's excluded.

twist.text: Pharmaceutical companies cherry-pick trials. Publish the positive ones, bury the negative ones. Legally.

climax.text: The fix: always ask 'What data is missing?' and 'Who chose this starting point and why?'

punchline.text: Half the truth is a whole lie.

quiz.question: What makes cherry-picking deceptive?
options: It selects only supporting evidence while hiding contradicting data
